name: Management of Ocular Hypertension and Glaucoma
citation: NICE Guideline NG81: Glaucoma: diagnosis and management
rules: IF person with ocular hypertension or diagnosed glaucoma has newly diagnosed ocular hypertension with IOP ≥ 24 mmHg THEN assess for risk of visual impairment within their lifetime.
IF person has a risk of visual impairment AND cannot tolerate their current treatment THEN offer an alternative generic PGA.
IF alternative generic PGA is not tolerated THEN offer a beta blocker.
IF neither alternative generic PGA nor beta blocker is tolerated THEN offer non-generic PGA, carbonic anhydrase inhibitor, sympathomimetic, miotic, or a combination thereof.
IF SLT is not suitable for a person THEN offer a generic PGA.
IF IOP is not sufficiently reduced with SLT or medical treatment THEN refer to a consultant ophthalmologist.
IF person chooses not to have SLT THEN offer a generic PGA.
IF person is waiting for SLT and needs treatment in the interim THEN offer a generic PGA.
IF person's current treatment is not reducing IOP sufficiently THEN offer a medicine from another class (beta-blocker, carbonic anhydrase inhibitor, or sympathomimetic).
IF IOP is not reduced despite treatment with PGA THEN ask about adherence and eye drop instillation technique.
